Our community - families, law enforcement, social service agencies - must come together to do everything possible to prevent these horrific and unnecessary tragedies. The consequences of not doing so is a matter of life and death.
In the case of Rio Rancho, the organizations obligated to protect children must be more vigilant and do a better job of preventing abuse, neglect, and deaths.
Ultimately judges have a sacred responsibility to safeguard public safety, protect vulnerable populations, and ensure that the community is not subject to further risk.

In the case of Taos County, I share concerns w/ members of the community that those important protections may have been misapplied. We have an obligation to re-examine NM‚Äôs pre-trial detention policies, which empower judges to detain a defendant due to the severity of the crime.
Every decision throughout the judicial and bail process needs to be made with the best interest of children and the safety of the community in mind.

The recent disturbing reports of violent child abuse in Taos County & Rio Rancho are abhorrent and must be thoroughly investigated. Those responsible must be prosecuted to the full extent of the law and brought to justice.
